Package model

Class Wordle

java.lang.Object
model.interfaces.MyObservable
model.Wordle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Wordle extends MyObservable implements Serializable
This class is the main logic/model in the game.
Author:
UBIS

  • Constructor Details

    • Wordle

      public Wordle()
      The constructor creates a library of words of length 5, generates a word for the user to guess, and initializes the number of attempts left. It also initializes the attempts to empty strings (the reason we do this is because we're going to concatenation on the attempts so they need to be already initialized). The constructor also initializes the index of the current attempt.

    • Wordle

      public Wordle(String word)
      This constructor does the same thing as the previous constructor except for generating a random word. This constructor allows us to choose the correct guess and will be used for testing.

  • Method Details

    • addAttempt

      public void addAttempt(String keyContent)
      Parameters:
      keyContent - : the content of the key pressed/clicked This method grows our current attempt.

    • getAttempt

      public String getAttempt()
      Returns:
      the current attempt. This method is necessary for when we update the keyboard view.

    • getPositions

      public Integer[] getPositions()
      Returns:
      feedback received on the attempt. (feedback is explained better in Attempt class) This method will be called in the views because it tells us which tiles to color in green, which tiles to color in yellow, and which tiles to color in black.

    • isLockedIn

      public boolean isLockedIn()
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating if the current attempt is locked in. In other words, if enter was clicked/pressed.

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon()
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating if the player has won.

    • hasLost

      public boolean hasLost()
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating if the player has lost

    • curButtonIndex

      public Integer curButtonIndex()
      Returns:
      the index where the next letter will be entered.

    • mostRecent

      public String mostRecent()
      Returns:
      the most recent letter entered. This method is necessary when updating AttemptView.

    • exists

      public boolean exists()
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating whether the word exists in our data base.

    • getAttempts

      public Attempt[] getAttempts()
      Returns:
      the array containing the attempts. This method is necessary for persistence (when we load an unfinished game).

    • numberOfAttempts

      public Integer numberOfAttempts()
      Returns:
      the number of attempts left

    • getCorrect

      public String getCorrect()
      Returns:
      the correct word.
